message.content:
<<<api>>>: Cipher.init
<<<code>>>: /* Derive the key, given password and salt. */
SecretKeyFactory factory = SecretKeyFactory.getInstance("PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256");
KeySpec spec = new PBEKeySpec(password, salt, 65536, 256);
SecretKey tmp = factory.generateSecret(spec);
SecretKey secret = new SecretKeySpec(tmp.getEncoded(), "AES");
/* Encrypt the message. */
Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding");
cipher.init(Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, secret);
AlgorithmParameters params = cipher.getParameters();
byte[] iv = params.getParameterSpec(IvParameterSpec.class).getIV();
byte[] dataBytes = Files.readAllBytes(Paths.get(file.getAbsolutePath()));
byte[] cipByte = cipher.doFinal(dataBytes);
byte[] encr = Base64.getEncoder().encode(cipByte);
Files.write(Paths.get(encryptedFile.getAbsolutePath()), encr); //encr len = 173517
/* Decrypt the message, given derived key and initialization vector. */
Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding");
try{cipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, secret, new IvParameterSpec(iv));}
catch(Exception e) {System.out.println("Something went wrong.");}
byte[] decr = Base64.getDecoder().decode(Files.readAllBytes(Paths.get(encryptedFile.getAbsolutePath())));
byte[] plaintext = cipher.doFinal(decr);
Files.write(Paths.get(decryptedFile.getAbsolutePath()), plaintext);
<<<explanation>>>: The code first generates a SecretKey from a given password and salt using PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256. Then it initializes a Cipher in ENCRYPT_MODE with the generated key. It reads the file to be encrypted into a byte array, encrypts it using the Cipher, and then encodes the encrypted byte array using Base64. The encoded byte array is then written to the encrypted file. To decrypt, the Cipher is initialized in DECRYPT_MODE with the same key and the initialization vector used for encryption. The encrypted file is read into a byte array, decoded from Base64, and then decrypted using the Cipher. The decrypted byte array is then written to the decrypted file.
